title: Mario Mutsch - Wikipedia
snippet: Mario Mutsch (born 3 September 1984) is a former professional footballer who played as a defensive midfielder. Born in Belgium, he played for the Luxembourg national team. Born in St. Vith, Mutsch started his career at Belgian lower leagues sides Spa and Kelmis (La Calamine) before heading ...

title: Mario Mutsch
snippet: Mutsch's role at St. Gallen emphasized team stability, where he formed part of the defensive midfield structure that supported the club's mid-table consistency in the Super League during those years. Across his Swiss clubs from 2011 to 2017, he accumulated approximately 174 appearances, underscoring his longevity in the league.[18] After six years abroad, primarily in Switzerland, Mario Mutsch returned to Luxembourgish football by signing a free transfer with Progrès Niederkorn on 1 July 2017, following his departure from FC St.
